name: Thursday Night Modern Folk Dinner with Dandelion Highway
description:
Craving modern Folk music uniquely steeped in Irish and Canadian singer-songwriter traditions? Then dive into the world of Dandelion Highway formed in 2023 by musical duo Kayleigh McGavock and Chris Sytnyk.

Born and raised in Waterford, Ireland, McGavock is a soulful folk singer with a uniquely creative approach to the guitar. Sytnyk is a Canadian touring and session musician who has shared the stage and studio with some of Canada’s biggest musical acts. The two artists began collaborating after attending a concert for Irish singer CMAT together and realizing they shared a love for Irish Folk Songs, puppies and grapefruit tea.

name: Friday Night French Jazz with the Lounge Academy
description: The Lounge Academy was inspired by the debut album of Julie London, Barney Kessel and Ray Leatherwood, they mix in some Chet Baker, French jazz and swing.

name: Thursday Late Night Alternative Party with Queer Emo Nite
description: Toronto's queerest, saddest and wildest party, bring your most fabulous outfits down to the mosh pit and make some new queer sad friends!

name: A Canvas & Bear Paint Pouring Workshop
description:
Play with colours and patterns with this satisfying art technique. Let loose and express yourself in a fun and fluid way. Embrace the unpredictable patterns to create a one of a kind piece of art. No experience needed.

Please see more Paint Pouring Workshops here: https://www.artboxstudiogallery.com/paint-pouring

name: Lahore Theatrical Performance at Todmorden Mills
description:
Todmorden Mills is proud to present Lahore, a FREE theatrical performance in partnership with SAWITRI Theatre Group. 

When new borders are drawn, where and what does one call home? Is there place for love and harmony amidst hate-induced violence? Set in the aftermath of the Partition of India, Lahore explores the universal meaning and feeling of belonging and home. 

Performed in Gujarati, with English subtitles available, be immersed in this heart-warming tale. Recommended for ages 10+. Some scenes of violence and loud noises. Please see below for ticket link.

Founded in January 2003, SAWITRI Theatre Group is an award-winning, not-for-profit organization specializing in South Asian narratives that resonate universally.

organizer.name: Toronto History Museums: Todmorden Mills Heritage Site

name: Toronto Halal Bites Festival
description:
A celebration of Halal food, culture and community!

Join us for a vibrant three-day food, culture, and art festival celebrating diverse halal cuisine, community, and artistic expression. As Toronto’s premier halal-focused festival, it offers brands a unique opportunity to connect with a highly engaged, multicultural, and family-oriented audience. The event will feature live art installations, an art gallery, cultural performances, a live cooking show, and interactive exhibits that showcase the rich artistic traditions of various communities.

name: A Vision Board Wellness Workshop
description: Let your dreams and goals be made into art at our vision board workshop. Work with a variety of images and unique materials to create an artistic vision board designed to manifest your dreams into reality. Enjoy some tea with a splash of art therapy by practitioner and owner of Artbox, Natasha Aird.

name: Yoga Mornings at Soulpepper Theatre

location.name: Young Centre for the Performing Arts

description:
Start your day with some morning yoga to gently wake up your body, breath, and senses. Each class will explore some meditation, pranayama (breathwork), and other grounding techniques for the nervous system, as well as move through some movement and stretches to gently energise the body.

Suitable for all levels including beginners. Seated, standing and lying down poses will be included with different options and students are encouraged to find and choose what works best for them.

name: Venezuela Viva – Music from Venezuela and the Caribbean
description:
The Upper Canada Choristers and their accomplished Latin-American ensemble Cantemos celebrate the rich diversity of Venezuelan music, with its African, Spanish, Caribbean, and Indigenous cultural influences. 

Laurie Evan Fraser conducts, with Hye Won (Cecilia) Lee as pianist. Special guests are La Petite Musicale of Toronto, a vivacious folk choir originally from Trinidad and Tobago, conducted by Lindy Burgess; and internationally renowned Venezuelan composer and conductor César Alejandro Carrillo and his wife, poet Laura Morales Balza on their first Toronto visit.  Emceed by Venezuelan-Canadians Antonio Mata and Cecilia Salcedo.

Also streaming live at https://www.uppercanadachoristers.org.

name: AGO 125 Birthday Party
description:
The AGO is turning 125, and we’re kicking off the celebration with a big birthday party after hours! Sip, dance, and explore dazzling visuals, hands-on activities, and a journey through time in our collection.

Immerse yourself in the experience as we transform the first floor of the gallery to celebrate this milestone. Enjoy live music by DJ Clymaxxx and students from the Royal Conservatory of Music, while discovering treasures from the AGO’s past. The gallery after dark has never felt this alive!

The event is 19+. Cash bar and snacks will be available.

name: A Glow-in-the-Dark Paint Pouring Workshop
description:
Stimulate your senses as you play with glowing colours in our black light art studio. Let loose and express yourself in a fun and fluid way with this satisfying art technique. Embrace unpredictable patterns and create a piece of art as unique as a finger print. No experience needed!

Please see more Glow in the Dark Workshops here: https://www.artboxstudiogallery.com/glow-in-the-dark-paint

name: Dyke Night
description: Explore the Fortitude/Fragile exhibition through a dyke lens with a democratize-the-docent polyvocal tour for the 2SLGBTQ+ community at Onsite Gallery. Continue afterwards from 8 pm till late at Sweaty Betty's for an afterparty featuring DJs, readers, and special guests.
